comments:
0515

It may not be styled text who's leaking the handles, but its where I got the 
exception.

Had a modest number of editors open, was switching from debug to java browsing 
perspective, had just performed a number of searches (text and java), had been 
working for about 2 hours in the same workbench.  Nothing unusual in my usage 
that I can think of.

Even after closing a few editors I was still getting this error when next one 
would get focus.

Unfortunately now my workbench won't start up - I get splash screen for awhile 
then it just dies.  Nothing of value in .log.

Created an attachment (id=838)
Deleting .metadata\...\workbench.xml got me going again, not surprisingly.  Attached.

In restarted workbench (with no editors on startup), was able to get error 
again with only a few editors open.

Not sure how much you have to leak to get "no more handles" on win2k, 
but it's a lot.

SN, we need to investigate. 

Added LK to the CC list since we ran out in StyledText.
*** Bug 11507 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I just got this bug today.
Running in 20020508 on Win98 (my home machine).

I was still able to open the Help About dialog to see what drop I am running.
(i.e. it seems there are a few handles still around).
StyledText is not repainting. I will try a few more things, but first I will 
save this comment in case the machine hangs or anything.

What I was doing when this happened:
- this eclipse has been up for several days (I think at least 3?)
- 5 editors open
- I had a Find/Replace dialog open
- I was repeatedly selecting a line of code, and then pasting a new line of 
code over it

Created an attachment (id=901)
Got this dialog each time I tried to give eclipse focus again

Created an attachment (id=902)
Got this dialog once (and ignored it <g>)

Created an attachment (id=903)
Here is the crash dialog

Happened again - basically the same stack trace.
Eclipse has been up for several hours, working fine.
This time, the "internal error in internal error" dialog occurred first, and 
then the "internal error in SWT" dialog. (last time, it was the other way 
around).
Eclipse did not even have focus when the dialog came up. I was pasting a screen 
snapshot into MS Paint.
I had 3 perspectives open (Java, Debug, CVS), and I was in the Java 
perspective, with 6 editors open.
This time I told the dialog Yes, exit the workspace.

Happened again right away on workspace restart, after double-clicking an editor 
tab in the editors CTabFolder. Very similar stack trace, except that it looks a 
bit more like Kevin's in that it died in Image.init.
I have several other apps open: Word, 5 instances of MS Paint, MSDN Lib, IE, 
and 2 Notepads. It looks like I can replicate this after only several hours. 
Please tell me what to look for, or if there's any debug stuff I can run - 
maybe Sleak or something. Note that I am still in 20020508.

In case it's useful, here's the top few lines of the stack trace:

!STACK org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1912)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1819)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.init(Image.java:1497)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.performPaint(StyledText.java:4675)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.handlePaint(StyledText.java:4640)

Happened again after about 20 minutes.
Similar setup, similar stack trace, walkback is in StyledText.performPaint.
This time, I had a Find/Replace dialog open, and I clicked Find Next.
Got the "SWT out of handles" dialog, and clicked No don't exit eclipse.
After this, I was still able to scroll the StyledText, and the cheese that was 
present after the dialog was dismissed was scrolled away.
I noticed that the Find Next had actually finished executing - the text I was 
trying to find was selected.
I was actually able to keep working for a little while, typing in the 
StyledText and then saving my file.
Decided to exit Eclipse so I don't lose anything.

I don't know if these observations are helpful, but:
- I can get the error if I double-click on a tab to make the editor larger 
(maximize).
- I do not seem to get the error if I double-click on a tab to make the editor 
smaller (restore).
- do not seem to get the error when I am working in a changes browser in the 
synchronize view.
- I can get the error when clicking Find Next in the Find/Replace dialog.
I will try turning off the 'avocado' and the 'red sea' to see if I still get 
the error.

Error still occurs after turning off:
Show problems before compiling
Highlight current line
Highlight problems

Still occurs after turning off Show overview ruler.
Suggestions for other features to turn off?

Got again in today's build (0530).  Noticed it in log following a different 
error (presumably unrelated).

When Windows 98 runs out of resources due to someone leaking, the failure 
happens when the next person tries to allocate a GDI or USER resource.  Since 
StyledText allocates and frees resources while you type and people type lots in 
the IDE, the failure happens in StyledText but the leak can be anywhere.

That's understandable, but I am running win2k, which I thought had a much 
larger resource pool.

I am not doing anything particular challenging for the IDE, so either we are 
leaking bad, or we are tying up too many resources.  I agree that its not 
necessarily an SWT bug.
I'm closing this.  Feel free to reopen this PR if it happens again.
